alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 01 at 2:35PM MDT until November 03 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches with 6 to 12 inches along and west of US Highway 89. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph Wednesday morning. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region and Adjacent Northern High Plains including eastern Glacier and western Toole Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Midnight MDT Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow development will likely hold off until tonight for the high plains. Northerly winds and falling temperatures tonight and on Wednesday could lead to rapidly deteriorating conditions along Highway 2 from East Glacier to Cut Bank.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Northern High Plains
